headline: Chicken Marsala Florentine
description: This is a gorgeous chicken dish with sun-dried tomatoes, spinach, and mushrooms. It is so wonderful when served with garlic mashed potatoes. It tastes fantastic!
name: Chicken Marsala Florentine

recipeInstructions.text: Place chicken breasts between two pieces of wax paper, and pound to 1/4 inch thick with a meat mallet. Dust chicken with flour, salt , pepper and oregano.
In a skillet, fry chicken in olive oil over medium heat. Cook until done, turning to cook evenly. Set aside, and keep warm.

In the same pan, melt the butter over medium heat; add mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, and Marsala wine. Cook for approximately 10 minutes, stirring occasionally. Mix in spinach, and cook for about 2 minutes. Serve over chicken.

review.reviewBody: Simply, easy and yummy!

This was a huge hit! Love the sun dried tomato portabella and spinach combo. The marsala taste after simmering for 10 minutes was a little strong for me and there wasn't enough sauce so I added 3 cups chicken base and a little corn starch to thicken it up. Wonderful!! The party I made it for thought I was a professional chef. Love it!!
Delicious I would add a bit of chicken Broth for more sauce.
We all liked this very much! The only changes I made were adding a clove of garlic, just a sprinkle of italian seasoning, 5oz of spinach and added a touch of cream at the end. Really good!

Everybody loved it! I just stirred on about a Tbs of Better than Boullion chicken broth concentrate into the sauce, and then a splash of heavy cream after it was done cooking. Beautiful and delicious!

I love this recipe. It's very tasty. I don't use the dried tomatoes. My husband doesn't like them, but I do. 
Easy to make and delicious .
I added Sauvignon Blanc because I didn’t have Marsala, but other than that I stayed true to recipe, was delicious!!

Love this! I didn’t have the wine, so added a half cup vinegar and two tablespoons jelly instead. Also added a small chopped purple onion. Loved all the butter! Made it richer. I substituted the oregano for basil, and it was a hit. This one is going to be a keto favorite for us!
Very good. Wish there was more liquid to spoon over the pasta. Hubby and son raved it was restaurant quality.

Followed recipe. Sauce was too watery while cooking so i added a mixture of 2 tablespoons flour and water to add to pan and it thickened it. Delicious flavor but needed more sauce for rhe pasta and didn't have enough. I used 2 cups spinach. I will ise more marsala and less butter because as is the sauce is not thick wnoigh.

I have made this many times. It always turns out great! Have used regular white mushrooms instead of portobellos, made without sun dried tomatoes, and without spinach at times, just depending on what I have on hand. Also have added a bit of half and half to pan at end of cooking, which results in an even richer, more decadent sauce. Simple, yet absolutely delicious. Looks and tastes like a sophisticated meal you would order at a high end restaurant. This one’s a keeper.
I love the sun-dried tomatoes with the spinach. The sauce is fantasic.
fantastic
2T butter + 2T olive oil, 1 each for chicken and mushrooms. Cook mushrooms in oil and butter, then deglaze pan with wine before adding tomatoes and spinach.

This recipe is Oh SO GOOD! Like the other reviews, however, I also added 2 cloves of minced garlic, cut the butter in half (even with half butter-it is a very very rich meal), and extra spinach. Delightful, but not healthy in the least.
I cut the butter to 1 and 3/4 cups and doubled the spinach. Still turned out great!
Simple, but very effective! Great meal!

Great recipe! I did follow other reviews and removed the chicken from the pan once it was cooked. I sautéed the veggies and made the sauce while the pasta cooked and did save some pasta water to add to the sauce. For those wondering about the sun dried tomatoes they really added a lot to the dish. I topped it with some fresh parmesan cheese. I will absolutely make this again! 

I will absolutely make this again!
I didn’t use the sun dried tomatoes bc I am not a tomato fan but instead I used green and red peppers. Was delish!
Made exactly as written (except used home canned Chantrelle mushrooms because that's what I had) and served over penne. Delicious and quite easy! I'll definitely make this again.
Great recipe. Enjoyed by all.
Everyone loved it. It was a nice twist on an old favorite. Will definitely make again. Next time I will double the sauce.

Overall it wasn’t a bad dish. I do think there was a little too much butter in the recipe. Next time I might change it. I added a little more spinach and mushrooms than what the recipe recommends. My husband loved it and my kids ate it, basically a win for dinner. A must try if you’re looking for something different for dinner.

Very delicious and flavorful! I added 1 scallion and used chicken breast tenders instead if chicken breast filets. My only suggestion is to simmer the chicken a little longer to have the chicken consume more of the marsala flavor..

This is a great simple recipe that tastes delicious. I followed some of the reviews and tweaked the recipe a little by adding a little chicken broth and some cream. I have made this recipe several times over the past few weeks. I have paired it with garlic mash potatoes and at times angel hair pasta. It is a real keeper and I have shared it with other family members

Great recipe, made it for my wife for her birthday today and got rave reviews.

Used sliced baby bellas, 2 pkgs, and 2 pkgs of sun-dried tomatoes, a bit more than a cup, plus some extra spinach. Left the marsala wine and butter the same.

Found the tomatoes became sweeter the longer you cook them, went about 20 minutes for that and reduction of the mushrooms, so to keep the meal from drying out in the pan I added just about 1/2 cup chicken broth. Also added the chicken back as soon as the spinach reduced by half.

All in all, a fantastic meal and a new addition to my go-to list for any occasion.
One of the most fantastic dishes I’ve ever cooked!
I followed the suggestions of another reviewer and added garlic and green onions to the sauce. All of of my dinner guests added salt. Great mix of flavors. I served with egg noodles.
I added the potatoes to the sauce after I cooked them. My chicken didn’t stay breaded very well but I used chicken tenderloins instead. It was pretty good.
Did not make any changes and would make it again.

Love this recipe. I have made this pretty much to the recipe. I added some garlic and onion with mushroom (personal preference) and added alittle bit of 1/2 that I needed to use up. I like a little bit thicker sauce. I easy and awesome!
Added Parmesan cheese. This was delicious!!! Used huge sundried tomatoes

This recipe is very good. I served it over spaghetti. I also reduced the recipe for 2 people and prepared the recipe as is with a slight change in the procedure of adding wine. With those modifications mentioned here is how I prepared this recipe: First, with a pairing knife, I sliced horizontally slice each breast to make 4 pieces. I thinned out each piece with the kitchen hammer just a bit as the pre slicing gets half the hammering job done. Second, I proceeded to make the recipe as if for 2 people, so I kept the proportions for a 2 people recipe. Third, after frying the breasts, I added half the amount of wine (4 TBSP) and proceeded to scrape the bits from the pan and let the wine evaporate a bit. Then, added the mushrooms and tomatoes. In this step, I added 1/4 cup of butter (4 TBSP) and as soon as it started melting, I added the remaining amount of wine. I also added the chicken juices and proceeded to put the chicken on top and covered for barely 3 minutes. Last, I added the spinach and covered again until the vapor wilted the spinach a bit, without letting it get dull in color while the juices thickened a bit. With those "changes" which mainly are techniques applied to the basic recipe, I made it. Honestly, this was delicious and still yielded leftovers. I could imagine this over a classic risotto Parmesan, and it would just be great too!
Served over bed of mashed potatoes in wide rim white bowl. Beautiful presentation.
this is not chicken marsala as some people are calling it IS CHICKEN MARSALA FLORETIN It has spinach in it which makes it floretine

The only changes I made was recommended by others:
- 1/2 C butter and added additional olive oil for sauce. 
- Added 1T chopped garlic and salt to taste. 
- Used lots of mushrooms (28 oz.)

The family really loved it. Will make again
This was my first time making this and it was good. The only thing I would change is add more salt, garlic, and onion.

This was absolutely DELICIOUS! I did not change the recipe at all except I wilted more spinach. I served the chicken and spinach on top of a bed of mashed sweet potatoes. The sweet potatoes complemented the spinach, chicken, and sun dried tomatoes perfectly. I will definitely make this again!

Made this dish for a dinner with 12 guests.
It was easy to make and everyone raved about it.
I followed the recipe as adjusted for 12 people and did not make any changes. It was perfect.

Made this dish for a dinner with 12 guests.
It was easy to make and everyone raved about it.
I followed the recipe as adjusted for 12 people and did not make any changes. It was perfect.
I didn't have sun dried tomatoes, and I added onions.

Love this recipe and my husband is still talking about it. I made a couple of changes. I used boneless, skinless chicken thighs only because we like them better. I also added a little garlic, again because we like garlic. Served over angel hair pasta. Will definitely make this again! Yum!

I made this recipe almost as written, I did add more spinach because I didn’t want to make a separate vegetable. I served it over mashed potatoes, it was delicious. As a matter of fact, we had it twice this week,
I found that it was a little bland for my taste.I will not make it again.

This is a nice change from regular Chicken Marsala recipe that I have. I didn't have the portobello mushrooms so had to use regular. Portobello would give it a little more flavor cause they have a nutty flavor. Will make again because it is really very easy & not time consuming. I did use the sun-dried tomatoes & will unless I run out & then would try using the grape tomatoes, but don't think they'd be as tasty.
Will definitely make it again
One of the my favorite dishes I've ever made! I didn't use a full 3/4 cup of butter, just one stick and added some of my own spices. I also added diced potatoes. Amazing!
I made this for the first time and everyone loved it ,I might try adding some garlic , basil and onion next time and see what happens
Very tasty! Loved the flavour! More Marsala so there is more juice for the spaghetti.

This dish was easy & quick to prepare but oh so delicious! I will definitely remember this one for company—it tastes so yummy but is also so pretty with the colors of the sun dried tomatoes k spinach. I followed the recipe exactly & added garlic
This is a great recipe! I didn't have sundried tomatoes so I sauted grape tomatoes from my garden instead, yum!
This was delicious! I added extra spinach and used less than a stick of butter. I served with rotini.
Perfect Italian rendition of a classic chicken marsala.
This easy and DELICIOUS!!!!
T his was a good recipe. I did add some flour after the butter and mushrooms to thicken it up a little. Turned out great. My husband loved it. I would make it again.
This is restaurant quality. I made no additions or substitutions & it was perfect
Delicious! I followed the recipe as written and it was so flavorful! Will most definitely make this again
Turned out great- we used 2 cups of spinach and 1/2 cup of wine and was a great dinner. Definitely will make again.
Easy recipe and will definitely make again.
Really good! Only complaint is it calls for too much marsala wine, but I was able to dilute the flavor a little bit with cream of mushroom soup
Too greasy
Followed recipe and it was very good!
I upped the spinach a bit since it reduces so much. A little more Marsala for the pan and the chef doesn't go astray ;-) Would maybe add a little lemon zest and a touch of garlic next time.
This was very easy and oh so tasty!!!
Very good. I served it over bowtie pasta. I did not have the sun dried tomatoes, but it wss still yummy.

I skipped the frying part and threw all the ingredients , (added 2 Tbsp chopped garlic & 1 small scallion)together in the crock pot on low for 6 hours. When I came home, I thickened slightly with a cornstarch, milk mixture and served over al-dente pasta; Incredibly easy and tasty. As an added note, parmesan cheese before serving is wonderful also.
Loved it. Made it for company and it was a hit. I made it as written and I would only change it to add garlic to the sauce.
This is fabulous. A quality dish that my husband and I really enjoyed. I used a bit more fresh spinach that the recipe called for (almost double). Came out perfectly.

After reading the other reviews I just seasoned the chicken with oregano, added a bit of chicken stock because I like more sauce & added garlic while the mushrooms were cooking. So so good!! I will probably add more veggies next time.
Delicious! And so easy to prepare! Will use this again when all the family is home - they'll love it too!
Cooked it tonight and I loved it! I don’t like wine so I added 3/4 cup cream cheese and milk to make it a sauce - delicious!!
This was good but I think it would be better without the sun dried tomatoes. I did add a bit of garlic and cream too.
I made this tonight it was so delicious. The key is to use a very good Marsala wine. I got my from the liquor store. Made in Italy
Very good, I substituted Tuscan Italian seasoning for the oregano and used more wine.
very easy, and I increased the mushrooms, spinach, and sun-dried tomatoes. I used a little less butter and Marsala, and it turned out great.

I made a quadruple batch of this for a large crowd. I used boneless chicken tenders to make portioning easier. I also used julienned sundried tomatoes in oil with spices, which added flavor, and more mushrooms and spinach proportionally. I used about 20% less marsala wine proportionally also, and it still had the marsala flavor. I made it about 3 hours before everyone came, and it held beautifully. The chicken stayed moist and all the flavors really melded together well. I froze some leftovers and it was just as good when defrosted. This is a keeper for me.
I do double the spinach, 1/2 cup of dried tomatoes. Love this recipe with mashed potatoes.
Served with long grain and wild rice and more spinach, fantastic!

Loved it! We followed comment suggestions. Regular mushrooms. Less butter, more spinach, and less Marsala. We didn’t have sun dried tomatoes so used fresh. Added garlic as we love it. Sauce lessened during cooking. Will double sauce recipe next time. Maybe add some chicken broth and flour roux mixture to thicken. Put chicken in sauce at end to reheat chicken and mix flavor. Added Parmesan cheese as topper.
Would use less butter next time.Otherwise tastes great
This was amazing I added a tbsp of capers with the sun dried tomatoes and my husband loved it!!!!!

This is a good recipe, but our family all agreed it had too much sun dried tomato. I love sun dried tomatoes, but I will decrease the amount to 1/4-1/2 cup next time as sun dried tomatoes have such a strong, tangy flavor and it overwhelmed this dish. I also added minced garlic and more spinach. Otherwise enjoyed this dish.

Made this recipe 3 times and it is a favorite. We love the mushrooms, so I add more. Used more sundried tomatoes to use up the jar, but next time will stick to the recipe. Make a day ahead--better when it sits in the fridge for 23-48 hours. I reheat slowly in the oven.
Wonderful recipe! Enjoyed a change from plain Marsala.
I cut down on the butter and added a little flour to the sauce. Dish came out very good. Would make again.

Absolutely amazing!! There was a moment of uncertainty regarding the sauce, I wasn't sure if it was suppose to cook down or remain liquid - but everything turned out perfectly!! It was a big hit. I didn't have Marsala wine so I used Zinfedale instead. Made roasted red potatoes instead of spaghetti.

I made this for the first time for company, which is always risky trying new recipes with company, but it turned out fantastic. Absolutely delicious. The only problem was my guests went home in distress because they couldn't stop eating it! I dislike it when people write reviews on a recipe and then mention they changed the recipe a bit. Well, I'm going to be one of those people. I only made two slight changes that I don't think made a big difference in the final results. I added 6 THIN slices of proscuitto (cut up) when sauteing the mushrooms, and I thickened the sauce with a little cornstarch and water. Definitely restaurant quality. P.S. I used sweet Marsala, not dry.

This dish is far, far less greasy if you omit most of the butter indicated to cook the tomatoes and mushrooms in as I did the second time I made it. 'Dry' (Communion Style) Masala wine is more pleasing then replacing it with dry Vermouth. The 'dry' fortified Masala imparts just the right amount of sweetness IMHO.

O m g I never review recipes but rely on other reviews for what I make. This recipe is absolutely fabulous with not a single modification. Our guests described it as fancy restaurant quality. Thank you thank you. This one is a new favorite!
I really loved this recipe. The chicken turned out great and the spinach and mushrooms were awesome together. This is not your typical Chicken Marsala recipe, but a keeper none the less.
Very good! 1/2 cup of spinach is a joke. 2 cups, now were talkin'.
added a touch of cream to the sauce at the very end amazing!!!!
This is a fantastic recipe. I used fresh asparagus instead of broccoli rabe. Used tiny shell macaroni, could not find orrecheitte pasta.
Very easy & yummy...
This was delicious and easy. My mods: less butter and less sundries tomatoes, added some chicken stock for extra sauce. We loved it
very good cut way back on the butter and added more spinach. will deffinetly make again.
Didn't change a thing and served with my own garlic mash and oven baked sweet potato chips and steamed broccoli. Smash hit!!

This dish turned out fantastic. I substituted cherry tomatoes for the sun dried tomatoes and served over a bed of fettuccine pasta. I stuck to the recipe as given and I wouldn't make any changes. Very easy to make in a very short time. This is definitely a keeper.
Very tasty. Great depth and blend of flavors. Easy dish.
